questions.question: According to the axioms of probability, if E1 and E2 are mutually exclusive events in a σ-algebra F, what is the probability of their union P(E1 ∪ E2)?
questions.correct_answer: For mutually exclusive events, P(E1 ∪ E2) = P(E1) + P(E2). This follows directly from Axiom 3 of probability which states that for mutually exclusive events, the probability of their union equals the sum of their individual probabilities.
